title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics' three-game winning streak ended with a 128-101 loss to the Houston Rockets.
Kevin Durant led the Rockets with 26 points, while the team shot 65.5% from 3-point range.
Boston faced a significant free-throw disparity, going 7-for-35 compared to the Rockets' attempts.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate D'Ernest Johnson to active roster ahead of Sunday's game against the Atlanta Falcons.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, steps in due to Rhamondre Stevenson's toe injury.
Johnson may contribute on offense and special teams, given his experience as a kick returner.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov's new defensive pairing has improved Bruins' defense, contributing to recent victories.
The Zadorov-McAvoy duo allowed only one 5-on-5 goal in over 73 minutes together, tightening Boston's defensive play.
Zadorov's physical style enhances McAvoy's offensive capabilities, aiding in Bruins' 2-1 win over Carolina Hurricanes.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed one goal in a 2-1 win against the Carolina Hurricanes, regaining form after recent struggles.
Boston Bruins shifted their goalie rotation, with Joonas Korpisalo starting back-to-back games before Swayman's return.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm expressed satisfaction with having two capable goalkeepers, Swayman and Korpisalo, fostering competition.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox enter offseason with $218.92 million committed in salary, $25 million below luxury tax threshold.
Several Red Sox players, including Alex Bregman, could become free agents when MLB offseason begins Sunday.
Red Sox Chief Baseball Officer Craig Breslow targets improvements in starting rotation and infield for upcoming season.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game this season with CBS's No. 4 broadcast crew against the Falcons.
The Patriots have a 6-2 record, with quarterback Drake Maye emerging as a Most Valuable Player candidate.
McCourty, now a CBS and ESPN analyst, is surprised by the quick improvement of the Patriots this season.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly pursuing Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before the NFL trade deadline, according to The Athletic.
Phillips, with 25 tackles and 3 sacks this season, is seen as a key target despite being in the final year of his contract.
The Dolphins demand at least a third-round pick for Phillips, as their recent losses fuel trade speculations.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Mason Lohrei has been scratched for the third consecutive game, missing the matchup against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm says Lohrei should be upset about not playing, emphasizing it's a learning phase for the young defenseman.
Lohrei's D-zone struggles contrasted with high offensive potential; Bruins favored Lindholm's return over him in the lineup.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons have a 3-4 record entering Week 9 against the Patriots, aiming to jumpstart a potential playoff run.
Running back Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game and is a dual-threat for the Falcons.
Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed per game with a strong secondary led by cornerback A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a crucial two-run single for the Dodgers in the third inning against the Blue Jays.
Kiké Hernandez made a decisive throw from left field, doubling up Addison Barger to end the game.
The Dodgers' 3-1 victory in Game 6 forces a Game 7 of the World Series against Toronto.
